competitors.name: Autodesk
competitors.notes: Major competitor in CAD software with AutoCAD and other design tools

competitors.name: Dassault Systèmes
competitors.notes: Competitor with CATIA for aerospace/automotive and SolidWorks for mid-market CAD/PLM

competitors.name: Siemens PLM Software
competitors.notes: Competitor with NX for enterprise CAD and Teamcenter for PLM solutions

competitors.name: UGS (Unigraphics)
competitors.notes: Major PLM competitor before being acquired by Siemens in 2007

competitors.name: Pro/ENGINEER competitors
competitors.notes: Various lower-cost CAD vendors that emerged in the mid-1990s challenging PTC's market position

competitors.name: MatrixOne
competitors.notes: PLM software competitor focused on product lifecycle management

context: In 2005, PTC was a leader in the CAD/PLM software market with its flagship Pro/ENGINEER product. The company acquired Arbortext for technical publishing technology, expanding beyond pure CAD. PTC faced competition from established players like Autodesk and Dassault Systèmes, as well as Siemens' growing PLM business. The market was characterized by the 'Big Four' players (PTC, Autodesk, Dassault, Siemens) who continue to dominate today.
